    Quick Start Guide for Survival Curve Extrapolation

Function reference

All functions

add_sheet()
Add an Excel worksheet through openxlsx if it doesn't already exist
check_converged()
Check whether survival models extrapolations converge for survival analysis
check_converged_cure()
Check whether cure models converge for survival analysis
check_converged_splines()
Check whether spline models converge
easy_adtte
Example clinical trial data from ggsurvfit
easy_bc
Formatted Copy of flexsurv::bc
easy_lung
Formatted Copy of survival::lung
easysurv-package _PACKAGE easysurv
easysurv: Estimate and inspect parametric survival models
fit.models.cure()
Fit parametric mixture cure survival models for health economic evaluations
fit_splines()
Fit spline models in survival analysis for health economic evaluations
get_fit_averages()
Obtain median, restricted mean, and mean survival times.
get_fit_coef()
Get parameter estimates from a fit.models object
get_fit_comparison()
Compare statistical goodness-of-fit between models in a fit.models object
get_fit_vcov()
Get the variance-covariance matrix from a fit.models object
get_fit_vcov_names()
Assign names as v1, v2, v3 to variance covariance matrices
get_median_FU()
Calculate the median follow-up time (or median time to censoring).
get_results_table()
Generate a parameter table with the vcov matrix from a fit.models object
get_results_table_cure()
Generate a parameter table with vcov matrix the object generated by fit.models.cure
plot_KM()
Plots a Kaplan-Meier Survival Curve using ggsurvplot with Custom Defaults
plot_fits()
Plot extrapolations of survHE objects with Custom Defaults
plot_schoenfeld()
Modified version of ggcoxdiagnostics to replace gather_ and set geom_smooth formulae
plot_smoothed_hazards()
Plot smoothed hazards of survival data
predict_fits()
Generate a data frame of predicted survival from a fit.models or fit.models.cure object
print(<quick_KM>)
Print quick_KM objects.
print(<quick_PH>) print(<quick_PH>)
Print quick_PH objects.
quick_KM()
Generate Kaplan-Meier (KM) plot and related KM info.
quick_PH()
Assess the proportional hazards assumptions with plots and statistical tests.
quick_fit() quick_fit_standard()
Get information and plots for standard parametric survival models
quick_fit_cure()
Get information and plots for flexsurvcure mixture cure models
quick_fit_joint()
Fit standard parametric survival models with a treatment covariate
quick_fit_select()
Get information and plots for parametric survival models
quick_fit_splines()
Get information and plots for flexsurvspline models
quick_start()
Launch an Example Script to Start Your Survival Analysis using the "lung" dataset
quick_start2()
Launch an Example Script to Start Your Survival Analysis using the "bc" dataset
quick_start3()
Launch an Example Script to Start Your Survival Analysis using simulated clinical trial data
quick_start_select()
Select an Example Script to Start Your Survival Analysis using "quick_start()" functions
quick_to_XL()
Export quick_... output to Excel via openxlsx
runMLE.cure()
Run maximum likelihood estimation (MLE) on cure models for survival analysis
step_KM()
Tabulate KM data in a 'stepped' manner for external plotting
summarise_KM() summarize_KM()
Summarize the data in a survfit object
theme_easysurv()
Adds a custom theme for the package to a ggplot2 plot

Developed by Niall Davison, Brad Kievit.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
